greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n minus the greatest primorial number (A002110) which divides n: a(n) = n - A053589(n).
comment: Subtract one (in primorial base representation A049345) from the least significant nonzero digit of n, then convert back to decimal.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2310
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
mathematica: Table[If[n == 1, 0, n - Times @@ Prime@ Flatten@ Position[TakeWhile[#, # > 0 &], 1] &@ Function[f, ReplacePart[Table[0, {PrimePi[f[[-1, 1]]]}], #] &@ Map[PrimePi@ First@ # -> 1 &, f]]@ FactorInteger@ n], {n, 93}] (* or *)

Table[n - If[OddQ@ n, 1, Function[p, Product[Prime@ k, {k, #[[p]]}]][LengthWhile[Differences@ #, # == 1 &] + 1] &@ PrimePi[FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]]]], {n, 93}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 26 2016 *)
program: from sympy import nextprime, primepi, primorial
def a002110(n): return 1 if n<1 else primorial(n)
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 23 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 23 2016
